name: Blackberry Inn at Yosemite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our host Steve was right there to greet us when we arrived for our 5 night stay. We had a different breakfast every morning which was more than I could eat some mornings. Our Bramble Rose room had a comfortable bed and two recliners that we melted into at the end of each day. After the rustic bathroom facilities at Yosemite, it was nice to come home to a beautifully appointed bathroom.
reviews.title: Wonderful!!!

reviews.text: The common area with a refrigerator allowed one of us to stay up later without disturbing the other. We stored beverages and snacks for lunch in the fridge and packed them in our mini cooler for our day excursions. Steve has a beautiful AND comfortable accommodation.
reviews.title: Delightful Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Steve gave us excellent advice on planning our days, and where to get anything we needed, including a car repair. We met guests from all over the US as well as Great Britain and the Netherlands, from every generation. We spent a little time on the porch each day watching the humming birds come to the feeders. We can't say enough about how great our stay was!
reviews.title: Gorgeous B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband, teenage daughter and I stayed at The Blackberry Inn for three nights in June; truthfully, it wasn't long enough.
reviews.title: Will definitely stay there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at 7:00 PM after a very long, hard day of driving, and were afraid that we wouldn't be able to find this place. The MapQuest directions were a bit elusive, and the road was unfamiliar; yet, we found it with ease, and were greeted by Steve's gracious smile. Steve is just as others have described him...knowledgeable, dedicated, kind and cognizant of the amount of personal space each traveler desires.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It’s hard to find any other useful information that hasn’t already been given here in numerous reviews. So just count two more people with rating this B & B as one of the best. Steve and Alex were exemplary hosts, full of great advice and wonderful hospitality. Rooms are spotless, spacious and comfortable. We had a first floor queen room, with enormous bathroom. Plenty of closet space and nice sitting area with windows opened for the night air. Breakfasts were excellent and plentiful. We met wonderful fellow guests from all over the world and enjoyed sharing stories and experiences of Yosemite and more. Overall B & B was quiet and restful after a day at the park. So tired – who could watch TV? Porch chairs – horse farm to look out on and diving hummingbirds – who would want to watch TV?
reviews.title: Ditto everything is great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The drive back and forth to Yosemite was certainly doable – we stayed and did it for five days – it was not a hardship at all. Max time took 20 minutes to the gate. There was a general store at the end of the road for gas and last minute supplies. But eats and more available in Groveland – not more than 15 minutes away.
reviews.title: wonderfully relaxing stay in beautiful surroundings
Perfect B&B Experience
reviews.text: Quick tips: take the trip to the Evergreen Lodge for dinner. Don’t leave Yosemite without driving and spending time along the Tioga Pass. Bike the valley – great way to get off your hiking feet and see all. Treat yourself to lunch at the Ahwahnee Hotel – great food, reasonable prices for lunch and wonderful dining scenery. Hike to Taft Point – quick, easy and what a view! Pack lunches – enjoy the views, trails, waterfalls and the thought of coming back to the Blackberry Inn to get good nights sleep.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We so enjoyed our stay of 3 nights in the Brameberry room. The wrap around porch, Steve's wonderful breakfasts, and his welcome and hospitality helped make our visit to Yosemite such a memorable one. Our son stayed in another equally beautifully appointed room- and we all enjoyed the balmy evenings on the porch with the humming birds, sweet little Cricket, and C....?.(number 14 in Spanish!!) , and a glass (or 2!) of Californian wine from the Sonoma Wine Country. Thank you so much Steve!! Despite England losing to Germany in the World Cup, our stay with you was the highlight of our 3 week Californian holiday!! Nansi, Geoff and Nick.
reviews.title: We will plan our next trip to the region around staying at the Blackbery Inn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed 5 nights at The Blackberry Inn, near Yosemite. We were at first disappointed that we couldn't get hotel reservations within Yosemite Village, but after traveling there and seeing how busy it is, were very happy that we chose The Blackberry Inn. While approximately 45 mins. drive from inner Yosemite, the Inn was a great choice. Steve and Alex, the innkeepers, were wonderful hosts - welcoming, helpful, but not intrusive. Very informative about the area, they steered us in the right directions. The rooms were comfortable and spotless. Steve's breakfasts were delicious, and Alex's packed lunches just the thing for a hike in the Park, which takes you many miles from restaurants or markets. We also met very interesting folks at the breakfast table -- amazing how many were from England! (Hi, Claire and Ollie!). Thanks, Steve and Alex, for a great inn experience. As we told you, you are doing everything right!
reviews.title: Delightful Experience!

reviews.text: I have mixed feelings writing this review. I have found a marvelous place that I would like to be my place whenever I want to escape into the Sierra. But, writing this, I know that it will be harder to get a reservation. Nevertheless, I need to write my first hotel review. This place is heaven. The rooms are perfect in all ways. The location cannot be beat - only 13 miles from the entrance to Yosemite. Wildlife wander around the place and if one needs a day away from the crowds of Yosemite, you can pull up a comfortable rocking chair on the large wrap around porch and watch the deer and hummingbirds and listen to the wind in the trees. The innkeepers Steve and Alex are part of the charm of the place. Having traveled to all 7 continents, I find one of the nicest places in the world is only a few hours from my northern California home. Thanks Steve and Alex for providing such a beautiful and relaxing oasis.
reviews.title: A wonderful place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Blackberry Inn during part of our honeymoon trip across North America. We spent 3 nights in the Briar Rose room and it was fabulous. Steve and Alex really know how to run a B&B and their warmth and hospitality really added to our stay.
reviews.title: Wonderfuly stay on the Yosemite doorstep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was fantastic and very spacious and clean. We had a great view to the fields opposite and even saw deer on a couple of occasions. The bathroom was also spotless and there was a nice landing area for the guests to use upstairs. Little touches were also appreciated such as fresh cookies everyday, a selection of teas and coffees and also free internet.
reviews.title: One of the best B&Bs we've ever stayed at

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Steve also has great local knowledge and was able to advise us of the best hiking while still avoiding the crowds. Yosemite Valley itself can get quite crowded and the Blackberry was a wonderful oasis to return to. Although slightly out of the park, Groveland is within easy reach and the Hotel Charlotte is a definite recommendation for dinner - when they found out we were on honeymoon we were treated like local celebrities!
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, this was a great highlight of our trip. We would recommend the Blackberry Inn without hesitation and hope that one day we can return. Thank you Steve and Alex for making this part of our honeymoon so memorable.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights and enjoyed every minute, we couldn't have asked for more caring & helpful hosts. Steve's knowledge of Yosemite was encyclopaedic and he was able to tell us of walks that avoided the crowds.
reviews.title: Excellent in every department

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom was large & comfortable and the guest living room a great place to sit in the evening discussing the events of the day with other guests over a glass of wine.
reviews.title: How all B&B's should be! We cannot recommend it highly enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not only were the breakfasts amazing but the so were the packed lunches he made for us and I would strongly recommend taking advantage of these as the food in Yosemite Village was awful.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we return to Yosemite we'll definitely stay at the Blackberry Inn again!
reviews.title: An amazing place and a perfect location for any visit to Yosemite!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Blackberry Inn is a beautiful house, in a gorgeous setting. We enjoyed sitting in the rocking chairs on the front porch, watching the humming birds on the bird feeders, while sipping a cold beer after walking in Yosemite.
reviews.title: Like sleeping on a cloud

description: Welcome to simple pleasures and total comfort in your home away from home. The Blackberry Inn Bed and Breakfast is a romantic country farmhouse surrounded by National Forest, with a wraparound porch and hundreds of hummingbirds that visit daily.
